poem:
South Korean Morning

In the damp Seoul dawn,  
newsprint whispers across tables—  
impeachment, tumbling stocks.  
Even the air wavers  
between martial tension and calm.  
Yet, somewhere, a kettle hums,  
punctuating the stillness,  
and outside, a woman  
waits for the bus,  
a lull in the city's discord.  
Life, unscrolled, continues.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Korea crisis live: motion to impeach President Yoon submitted, say opposition parties 8.52am GMT Summary Thanks for following along with our live coverage of the extraordinary events in South Korea. It is 6pm in Seoul on Wednesday. Here is a recap of the past two tumultuous days in South Korean politics: Seoul’s stock exchange closes down more than one percent after short-lived declaration of martial law. The Kospi composite index tumbled 1.44 percent while". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
